page.title: 01GENERAL VILLAGE DESCRIPTION
page.content: Horseheath is a typical rural village. It had a major traffic problem with the A 604 Cambridge Colchester road passing through it. This however was replaced by a bypass some years ago. Many of the local inhabitants comment on the improvement in the quality of life in the village since this happened.There have been casualties as a result of the relocated road.Two village pubs have closed.The plant nursery has survived on the strength of the clientelle it had built up when the road was open. Manor Farm in the centre of the village had to have a tractor bridge built over the new road, to enable access to their land on the other side.The outstanding feature of the landscape is rolling fields of arable land
